Hi there Meddler, i took some of my time as to see what could be done to balance out Darius some more, and i came up with the idea of increasing the mana cost by X amount and create a new passive for the Q which sounds like this "When Darius hits an enemy champion with the outer blade part of his axe, regain 50% of the mana cost" This will nerf his ability to spam it on minions to push etc but preserve the same mana cost vs champs and in teamfights and reward him some more for hitting with the blade part without him going oom in a teamfight.

Was also thinking of reducing the delay on his Q when Darius is effected by "noxian might" by 0.50 secs so it will have a delay of 0.25 secs instead.

Btw, the new passive on his w makes no sense, pls remove it and and create a new passive for his E. "This ability now resets if Darius kills an enemy champion with his ultimate" This makes so much more sense, it doesnt give him  any form for dash or speed buff but allows him to be more sticky in team fights for that penta. The only thing the new passive on his W is good for is to use it om cannon minions lool.

Another idea i had is this.
New passive for "noxian guillotine" - "When Darius executes an enemy champion  all of his other skills resets by 25% Rank 1 ult, 50% rank 2 ult, 100% rank 3 ult.

These changes do not effect his laning phase or inreases his power in the laning phase expect for the reduced delay on Q while under noxian might.

Wow.. eerm I think 50 mana is quite a bit too high. It's nealry the twice amount of mana cost it has now.

With 50 mana cost you press Q twice and you already gave away an ulti-cost. I don't think that his Q is THAT strong, that it needs a 50 mana cost.

that should punish him for spamming a bit harder, but having recently played against darius, i noticed that his q blade radius is very high. its nearly impossible to walk into him to avoid the bleed and extra damage, and even if you try to run away he will still hit you with the very tip even if your champion doesnt look like he his in the warning area.

also his heal is very strong. if he didnt have the heal, he would be probably in a balanced state. if on the pbe they kept the heal to 12% missing hp per strike but not increase the max heal to 36 (instead lowering it to 24), that would help

and for a last note, maybe his movespeed should be reduced by 5-10. 340 is a very high number for a large juggernaut wielding a huge axe, and he has huge synergy with the movespeed bonus from black cleaver.

His blade is easy to dodge unless your MS is pitiful. Or simply use any movement ability to completely negate it. Plus, the blade is a bit less than half of the AoE. After boots, or even some MS from runes/masteries, all it takes to dodge it is being quick on your clicks. 

And Darius's movespeed is as high as it is because he needs it to function without a natural MS boost or gapcloser. If his MS got any lower, it would have a major impact on him at this point. 

As for the heal, its the reward for hitting more than one person with his Q. The heal is there so he can sustain past burst in team fights and to reward him for hitting people. The delay balances that out, because otherwise he would need something else on the Q or just have it hit insanely hard as compensation for the delay.

Why the hell would you walk into him giving an AA (plus another stack of his passive) and then since you're in melee range (by virtue of walking into him) you are probably eating more AA's and then getting dunked. I'm really confused by this post...

His attack speed is so slow, that if you take the handle on the Q(Which gives no stacks) and then immediately turn around, if he wants to continue that trade he has to commit HARD with everything he has.  And even then, he has lost his highest damage ability at that point, which lets most other top laners out damage him if they continue the trade. Its not hard to win a trade against him if you take the handle.

Take the blade on the other hand, and you have a likely chance of getting beat. I've won lanes as Darius now just because my opponent got cocky and thought they could take the blade and continue on. Darius punishes mistakes even harder now. Play cautiously and be quick to react to his wind up, and you are generally fine.

The real problem is people haven't figured out that if you sit on his face he does less damage to you than if you dance around like an idiot, all you have to do is run at him to make him miss sweetspot on Q or dash backwards. Getting hit with the handle of the axe does like 2 damage and doesn't apply his passive.  That said he is SUPER strong right now in teamfights or when he's outnumbered, an area he was bad in before the rework. Taking of 5-10 movement speed is probably the best nerf, since it makes his weakness even weaker without harming his "I will dunk your entire team if you choose to fight around me instead of kiting me and making me want to uninstall"

Like he ever used to be oom before the Juggernaut update. And if he does, he always have these two items to make up for *hypothetically* being oom: {{item:2041}} {{item:2004}}
He doesn't need to get 5 stacks to chunk you down for 25-50% of your total HP every time he engages. At level 3. His passive is a stacking DoT. He almost always wins trades because of it.

Which deals physical damage, so you can buy all the defense you need for early levels.. Which got nerfed as well, from 12-36 to 10-27 per stack. Only really deals damage when you take 5 stacks, because of Noxian Might. Fail ur Q and u deal 50% damage. No heal. No stack applied. If you do get chunked for that much and you don't trade back, then that is your fault. This is a team game, not 1v1. Ask for jungler help.

I think Darius needs a buff (late game I'm fine with the heal and potential mana cost Nerf). Nothing big ,but late game once his ult gets rank 3 people targeted by Darius ult wont take damage from  any other source except for Darius and all damage that would have been taken by the champion will occur after Darius does his damage (Think master yi alpha strike) . The idea being that he can get his passive off because in the late game the target I stack on is usually killed by my team before I can get an ult or 5 stacks.

People keep pointing out that Darius's Q has a delay, but it isn't as if he is immobile while he channels the Q.

The moment he starts channeling his Q, he can just keep walking and follow you to keep you within reach. Due to his innately high MS, your only option is to walk into him and eat more AAs, or use an ability to get out.

His mana costs are well balanced as they are, I would put them at the same level as Volibear. What you don't want is a champion like Malphite who is constantly oom even if you buy the mana items you are forced into building.
